text:
Problem
Edge runs on a distributed environment, which consists of different source of information.
label: current

text: Different modules run on different VMs and each of them provides different data for the same client.
label: current

text: Sometimes we spend hours to be able to respond to a simple question.
label: current

text: We need to simplify inspection process to reduce response times.
label: purpose

text: Proposed Solution
label: none

text: There are many lines of logs are produced for a single client starting from assigning an IP to disconnect.
label: current

text: Some of the logs are less important and some of them plays the key role.
label: current

label: functional

text: There will be several components in this solution:
label: overview

text: Resource Viewer
label: none

text: There will be an agent module on each server, which will periodically (crontab) monitor system resources (RAM, CPU, HDD, average load).
label: functional

text: Agent will save output to a set in redis, sorted by timestamp.
label: functional

text: It will also remove members older than a specified date (keep only last X hours for example).
label: functional

text: Resource usage will be held in this format: NUM_CPU|CPU_1|CPU_2|..|CPU_N|TOTAL_RAM|USED_RAM|TOTAL_SWAP|USED_SWAP|TOTAL_HDD|USED_HDD|LOAD_AVG
label: functional

text: RAM and HDD usages will be in MB.
label: functional

text: We can use psutil to get system information.
label: nonfunctional

text: Sets will be held in Redis in this format: m_<hostname>
label: nonfunctional

text: Each set name will be in another set named "resource_viewer"
label: nonfunctional

text: When requested, support tool will fetch keys from "resource_viewer" (where each key corresponds to a server), and for each server it will get outputs saved to Redis.
label: case

text: Parsing will be done when data is read from Redis.
label: functional

text: Log Producer
label: none

text: There will be a code piece or a small agent for every module, which will get meaningful logs and send them to log combiner.
label: functional

text: Getting logs can be done in two ways:
label: overview

text: Embedding a generic function into applications.
label: overview

text: Continuously watch for a special pattern in logs.
label: overview

text: Either way, when desired log is generated, it needs to be sent to log combiner.
label: case

text: Logs will be generated in following formats from applications:

label: functional

Log Combiner
Combiner will be have to process thousands of logs per second.
label: nonfunctional

text: Because of that, using a message queue with this component is highly recommended.
label: nonfunctional

label: scope

text:

- **Users**: Require a safe environment for sharing content.
label: scope

text: - **Moderators**:
label: scope

text: Need tools to efficiently review reports and manage content.

label: functional

text:

label: functional

text: - **Automated Content Filtering**:
label: functional

text: Implement machine learning algorithms to automatically detect and filter out inappropriate content before it is published.

label: nonfunctional

label: nonfunctional

text:

-
label: current

label: current

text: - Sufficient data exists to train the machine learning algorithms for automated content moderation.
label: current

text:

- Budget constraints may limit the extent of machine learning model training and testing.
label: overview

text: - Existing application architecture may require modifications to integrate the new feature.

text:

label: scenario

text:

text: - Potential expansion of moderation capabilities to include live content during streaming or real-time interactions.

text:

The User-Generated Content Moderation Tool is essential for maintaining the quality and safety of user interactions within the application.
